alert.note: Alert for Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 7:50PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Merrimack County through 830 PM EDT... At 750 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hillsborough, or near Henniker, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Concord, Henniker, Hopkinton, Bradford, Warner, Hillsborough, Boscawen, Andover, Webster, Salisbury, Sulton and Newbury. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 7 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
